api/Core.HideWarningsPreprocessor.html.title: Class HideWarningsPreprocessor | MEPModeller
api/Core.HideWarningsPreprocessor.html.keywords: Class HideWarningsPreprocessor Namespace Core Assembly Core.dll public class HideWarningsPreprocessor : IFailuresPreprocessor Inheritance object HideWarningsPreprocessor Implements IFailuresPreprocessor Inherited Members object.ToString() object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() Methods PreprocessFailures(FailuresAccessor) This method is called when there have been failures found at the end of a transaction and Revit is about to start processing them. public FailureProcessingResult PreprocessFailures(FailuresAccessor failuresAccessor) Parameters failuresAccessor FailuresAccessor The Interface class that provides access to the failure information. Returns FailureProcessingResult Notifies end of transaction code about further actions required. Return values are interpreted as follows: Continue - the failure processing will continue. Failures will be shown to the user, even if they were addressed by this method. ProceedWithCommit - end of transaction checks and failure processing will restart from the beginning. If some failures were resolved here, they will be removed and not delivered to the user. ProceedWithCommit cannot be returned if transaction is being rolled back. ProceedWithRollBack - the failure processing will continue. Failures will be shown to the user, but user will have no option to resolve or ignore them - only cancel option will be available. If intent is to roll back transaction without showing failures to the user, it can be achieved by setting failure handling option to remove failures before returning ProceedWithRollBack. Other return values are not allowed.
